Functions¶

These functions are documented for completeness, most are not intended for the end user to call directly

Pipe module¶

The Pipe module can be run as a standalone command line interface, but is mainly designed to be used as the back end of the web interface

pipe.commandgen(command, pathname, noproc=False)[source]¶

Main command processing function. Parses file system to find targets and then invokes the specific action script. Runs as a generator.

Parameters:
  • command – The action script or command to be executed
  • pathname – The root path to start the search from
Returns:

Yields text reports of success/failure
pipe.doActlist(command)[source]¶

Returns a list of all the action scripts available

Parameters:command – Not used
Returns:List of scripts
pipe.doDefault(command)[source]¶

The default prefix; Returns a list of paths containing the target

Parameters:command – Name of command script
Returns:A list of paths
pipe.doList(command)[source]¶

Combines the results of doRun and doRetry into a single list

Parameters:command – Name of command script; not used here
Returns:A list of paths
pipe.doOptlist(command, list={}, indent='')[source]¶

Returns all the program options

Parameters:command – Not used
Returns:List of options
pipe.doOptset(command)[source]¶

Sets the value of a option

Parameters:command – string formatted as “<option> <new value>”
Returns:string representation of the new option
pipe.doQuery(command)[source]¶

Returns a list of paths derived from an SQL query

Parameters:command – What is put after “WHERE” in the query
Returns:A list of paths
pipe.doRetry(command)[source]¶

Returns the paths that resulted in failure in the most recent run

Parameters:command – Name of command script; not used here
Returns:A list of paths
pipe.doRun(command)[source]¶

Returns the paths that have been flagged by the user

Parameters:command – Name of command script; not used here
Returns:A list of paths
pipe.parseAction(filename)[source]¶

Parses a script file to extract directives

Parameters:filename – The name of the script file
Returns:A list of directives
pipe.procCommand(command, pathname)[source]¶

Initialises the database and then invokes commandgen()

Parameters:
  • command – Passed to commandgen()
  • pathname – Passed to commandgen()
Returns:

None
pipe.runDisplay(path)[source]¶

Dumps contents to console. Needed as a placeholder function for commands that execute wholly in their prefix stage

Parameters:path – Prints this to the console
Returns:None
pipe.setProctabPath(pathname)[source]¶

Sets the database path

Parameters:pathname – The path to an sqlite database file
Returns:None

User State¶

class userstate.userState[source]¶
appendQueue()[source]¶

Add the contents of the process queue to the buffer

Returns:None
finalise()[source]¶

Checks if the process has finished, and if so performs finalisation operations

Returns:None
